duties_responsibilities.duty: Performing maintenance and repair on mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment.
Testing and inspecting machines or heavy equipment to diagnose defects.
Reading and understanding operating manuals, blueprints, and technical drawings.
Diagnosing faults or malfunctions to determine required repairs, using engine diagnostic equipment such as computerized test equipment.
Researching, ordering, and maintaining parts inventory for services and repairs.
Assembling, dismantling, and reassembling heavy-operating equipment using hoists and hand tools.
Clean, lubricate, and perform routine maintenance work on all facility vehicles to ensure efficient and safe operation.
Fabricating needed parts or items from sheet metal.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of four years vehicle and heavy equipment maintenance experience, or two years of mechanical trade school training and two years’ experience as a vehicle and heavy equipment mechanic.
